laboratory_examinations.findings: At age 10, no recordable rod response after standard dark adaptation; a normal combined response and normal cone response. At age 18, barely recordable rod response after standard dark adaptation with normalization (increase by over 700%) of the response after prolonged dark adaptation.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Significant increase in response after prolonged dark adaptation from age 10 to age 18; normalization observed after prolonged dark adaptation at age 18.

laboratory_examinations.findings: At age 18, demonstrated reduced central and peripheral responses.
At age 18, a reduced thickness of the RPE-outer segment complex measured at 66µm (median of 76µm in 25 normals) and significant retinal structure changes correlated with the albipunctate dots.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: At age 18, central retinal thickness reduction was documented.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Severely reduced FAF intensity index in the entire fundus at age 18, with a temporal macula/optic disk ratio of 1.4 (right eye) and 1.6 (left eye).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: FAF did not change after prolonged dark adaptation at age 18.
